name: SaaS Subscription
description: Recurring-access software or analytics platform with tiered pricing.
risks: Customer churn if value is not clear
Ongoing need for product updates and support

name: Freemium Conversion
description: Offer a free basic version and convert premium users through added features.
risks: Large free user base with low conversion
High infrastructure cost to support free users

name: Marketplace Platform
description: Connect buyers and sellers through a digital marketplace earning commissions.
use_cases: Marketplace for energy services or installers
B2B marketplace for lab services or testing
risks: Chicken-and-egg problem for supply and demand
Platform disintermediation once relationships are formed

name: Data-as-a-Service
description: Aggregate, enrich, and sell datasets or insights via subscription or API.
use_cases: Energy consumption and grid data feeds
risks: Customer lock-in risk if formats are proprietary

name: API Monetization
description: Expose core functionality through APIs and charge per call or tier.
use_cases: Embedding analytics or AI models into partner products
Access to simulation or optimisation engines
risks: Dependency on external developers for adoption
Cost spikes if infrastructure isn’t optimised

name: Hardware-as-a-Service
description: Offer physical equipment bundled with monitoring and recurring service fees.
use_cases: Battery storage systems with remote monitoring
risks: Complex contract management and credit risk

name: Product Leasing
description: Lease equipment or assets instead of selling outright.
risks: Residual value uncertainty at lease end

name: Usage-Based Billing
description: Charge customers per unit consumed (e.g., kWh, hour, transaction).
risks: Revenue volatility based on usage patterns
Customer confusion if pricing is unclear

name: Franchise Expansion
description: Replicate a proven model through franchisees under a unified brand.
use_cases: Service businesses with strong brand playbooks
risks: Brand damage if a franchise underperforms

name: Technology Licensing
description: License intellectual property to manufacturers or integrators.
use_cases: Software algorithms embedded in OEM systems
risks: Dependence on licensee’s ability to commercialise
Revenue uncertainty tied to licensee’s success

name: Consulting-to-Product Ladder
description: Start with bespoke services and evolve to a repeatable product.
use_cases: Innovation strategy consulting that becomes a toolkit
Carbon advisory that becomes a software platform
EV fleet advisory evolving into a management product
examples: Agencies that turned tools into SaaS products
risks: Difficulty transitioning from custom to standardised offers
Consulting can crowd out product focus
Scaling depends on codifying tacit knowledge

name: Managed Services
description: Operate and maintain client infrastructure for a monthly fee.

name: Pay-per-Outcome
description: Charge customers only when measurable results are achieved.
risks: Revenue uncertainty if outcomes are delayed
Disputes over baselines and external factors

name: Crowdsourcing Platform
description: Leverage community input or labor for innovation or microtasks.
risks: Platform trust and IP ownership issues

name: Ecosystem Orchestrator
description: Provide core infrastructure allowing partners to co-create value.
risks: High initial investment for uncertain payoff

name: Circular Economy
description: Design for reuse, refurbishment, and recycling to capture residual value.

name: Carbon Credit Generator
description: Earn or sell verified carbon offsets through sustainability projects.
risks: Policy and standard changes in carbon markets

name: Community Enterprise
description: Locally owned venture reinvesting profits into community development.
risks: Balancing social goals with financial sustainability

name: Hybrid Grant-to-Market
description: Combine early research grants with later-stage revenue sharing.
revenue_streams: Equity or royalties from successful projects
examples: Public innovation agencies with royalty models
risks: Long time horizons before revenue materialises

name: Subscription Box / Kit
description: Deliver curated products on a recurring subscription basis.
risks: High churn if curation is weak

name: White-Label Manufacturing
description: Produce goods for other brands to repackage and sell.
use_cases: Battery pack manufacturing for OEM brands
risks: Dependence on a small number of big clients
Capex and utilisation risk for factories

name: Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM)
description: Integrate products into other manufacturers’ systems.
use_cases: Supplying battery modules into EV OEMs

name: Aftermarket Services
description: Offer maintenance, upgrades, and consumables post-sale.
use_cases: Maintenance of industrial or energy equipment
risks: Need for broad field service capability

name: Open-Source Core
description: Free core offering, monetized through premium add-ons and support.
use_cases: Infrastructure tools for energy or climate analytics
risks: Confusion about what is free vs paid

name: Platform-as-a-Service
description: Provide development and deployment infrastructure as a service.
revenue_streams: Add-on services such as monitoring or security
use_cases: Developer platforms for AI or analytics tools
risks: Need to attract and retain developer communities

name: Product-Led Growth
description: Drive adoption through self-service product experience before sales.
risks: Product complexity can block self-serve growth
Need strong analytics and growth experimentation

name: Open Innovation Network
description: Collaborate across partners and startups for shared R&D outcomes.
use_cases: Joint R&D on hydrogen, batteries or EVs

name: Spin-out Venture
description: Form a new company to commercialize internal research results.
revenue_streams: Licensing or royalty flows to the originator
use_cases: University or public research turning into startups
Corporate labs spinning out deep tech ventures
risks: Governance challenges between parent and spin-out

name: Technology Transfer Office Model
description: License, incubate, and spin out institutional research IP.
use_cases: Public labs translating IP to industry
Hospitals or research institutes licensing clinical IP
risks: Long lag between research and revenue

name: Incubator / Accelerator
description: Support multiple startups in exchange for equity or fees.
use_cases: Climate tech or energy startup accelerators
risks: Reputation risk if quality is low

name: AI-as-a-Service
description: Offer AI or machine-learning models via subscription or API access.
use_cases: Credit or risk scoring for green finance

name: Digital Twin Solutions
description: Create virtual replicas of assets or processes sold as a monitoring or optimization service.
risks: Clients may underestimate data needs and effort

name: Blockchain Tokenization
description: Use blockchain tokens to represent ownership or usage rights for assets or services.
risks: Need for strong security and governance

name: Decentralized Marketplace
description: Peer-to-peer exchange of goods or services using smart contracts.
risks: User experience barriers for mainstream users

name: Tokenized Impact Credits
description: Issue tradeable tokens linked to verified impact outcomes (carbon, social, or biodiversity).
risks: Trust and integrity concerns in impact data
Perception of greenwashing if governance is weak
Regulatory treatment of tokens and securities law

name: Energy-as-a-Service
description: Provide energy infrastructure, operation, and optimization with pay-per-use billing.
revenue_streams: Service fees per kWh or per site
use_cases: Solar plus storage for commercial clients
EV charging networks operated as a service
risks: Large capital requirement and financing complexity
Operational and performance risk over long contracts

name: ESCO (Energy Service Company)
description: Finance and implement efficiency projects, repaid from cost savings.
revenue_streams: Shared savings from energy cost reduction
examples: Global ESCOs in building and industrial sectors

name: BOOT / PPP Concession
description: Build-Own-Operate-Transfer model for infrastructure with long-term returns.
examples: PPP toll roads and power plants
risks: Political and regulatory risk over decades

name: Blended Finance Platform
description: Combine grants, equity, and loans to de-risk early-stage innovation.

name: Green Bond / Climate Fund
description: Raise sustainability-linked finance instruments for project portfolios.
risks: Portfolio concentration in specific asset classes

name: Impact-Linked Loan
description: Loan with interest rates that decrease when social or environmental targets are met.
risks: Complexity in defining and measuring KPIs

name: Circular Supply Chain
description: Use materials-back loops where suppliers recover or refurbish used goods.

name: Re-commerce / Second-Life Market
description: Refurbish, remanufacture, and resell returned or used products.
risks: Sourcing sufficient volumes of used products

name: Digital Manufacturing Network
description: Cloud-connected production network offering on-demand fabrication.
revenue_streams: Premium services like QA or logistics
risks: Balancing capacity and demand across the network

name: Additive Manufacturing Services
description: 3D-printing components for clients using digital inventory and design files.

name: Servitization
description: Shift from selling equipment to selling uptime or outcomes (e.g., power-by-the-hour).
risks: Taking on performance and usage risk
Need for deep monitoring and analytics

name: Digital Subscription Community
description: Members pay recurring fees for access to expert content, tools, or support.
risks: Churn if value is not clear or unique

name: Creator Economy Platform
description: Enable creators to monetize audience engagement or digital assets.

name: Crowdfunding Equity Model
description: Raise small investments from many individuals in exchange for equity or perks.

name: Pay-What-You-Want
description: Let customers decide price, building loyalty and data for upselling.
revenue_streams: Upsell to fixed-price or premium offers
use_cases: Digital goods like e-books, templates or tools
risks: Need for strong storytelling and mission
May not work well for high-cost products

name: Dynamic Pricing Engine
description: Adjust pricing automatically using demand, time, or AI predictions.
risks: Customer backlash if pricing feels unfair

name: Ecosystem Membership
description: Charge annual membership for integrated ecosystem benefits and resources.
risks: Perceived value must stay high to retain members
Too many passive members reduce network value
Governance and conflict management across members

name: Digital Twin Maintenance Contracts
description: Bundle physical product sales with digital monitoring service contracts.
revenue_streams: Upgrades and retrofits informed by twin insights
examples: Premium maintenance bundled with digital services
risks: Responsibility for performance based on digital insights

name: Usage-Based Insurance
description: Premiums dynamically adjusted based on monitored usage data.
use_cases: Equipment insurance tied to usage and conditions
risks: Customer concerns about privacy and monitoring

name: Outcome-Based Healthcare
description: Payments tied to treatment results or patient recovery outcomes.
examples: Early pilots of value-based healthcare contracts
risks: Long feedback loops and clinical validation needs

name: Social Enterprise Hybrid
description: Combine profit motives with social impact goals and reinvestment.
revenue_streams: Service contracts with public or NGO partners
use_cases: Local manufacturing for jobs and impact

name: Gamified Engagement
description: Use points, rewards, or challenges to increase customer retention.
use_cases: Health and wellness behaviour change apps
risks: Shallow or manipulative gamification can backfire
Engagement may not translate into real value
User fatigue if mechanics are overused

name: AI-Generated Content Service
description: Provide automated writing, design, or video creation as a service.
examples: AI writing assistants and design tools

name: Micro-franchise Network
description: Create distributed small-scale franchises with shared branding and tools.
revenue_streams: Markup on shared inputs or tools
risks: Maintaining quality across many small operators
Ensuring fair value sharing and support

name: Subscription Repair & Maintenance
description: Offer ongoing maintenance plans for consumer or industrial goods.
revenue_streams: Premium on-site or priority service fees
examples: Third-party appliance or vehicle service clubs
risks: Accurate pricing versus real failure rates
Customer perception if service quality is poor

name: Predictive Analytics-as-a-Service
description: Sell predictive insights using proprietary AI models or datasets.
use_cases: Customer churn or credit risk analytics
risks: Need for continuous data updates and monitoring
Model drift and loss of accuracy over time
Client dependence on explanations and interpretability

name: Digital-Physical Hybrid Retail
description: Integrate e-commerce with immersive physical experiences or AR try-ons.
revenue_streams: Partnerships with brands in shared spaces
use_cases: Showrooms for EVs or tech devices
examples: Brands combining pop-ups and online sales
risks: Higher operating costs for physical experience spaces
Complex integration of digital and physical data

name: Tokenized Loyalty Program
description: Reward customers with tradeable digital tokens redeemable across partners.
revenue_streams: Data and analytics services for partners
use_cases: EV charging or mobility loyalty tokens
risks: Customer confusion around tokens and value

name: AI-Driven Personalization
description: Offer hyper-personalized products or content recommendations using AI.
use_cases: Targeted offers in mobility or retail
examples: Recommendation engines in e-commerce or streaming

name: Virtual Experience Economy
description: Monetize immersive VR/AR experiences for education or entertainment.
use_cases: Immersive education on energy, climate or health
Virtual tours of facilities or microgrids
risks: Motion sickness and user comfort issues

name: Knowledge Marketplace
description: Enable experts to monetize their insights and micro-consulting sessions.
use_cases: Expert calls on niche technical topics
Ad-hoc advisory for climate or energy projects
risks: Compliance with conflicts of interest rules
Matching supply and demand in niche domains

name: Platform Cooperative
description: Community-owned digital platform sharing value among contributors.
examples: Emerging platform co-ops in labour and services

name: AI-Assisted Research Lab
description: Provide automated research, simulation, and experiment-as-a-service tools.
risks: Validation of models against real-world data
Regulatory and IP questions around AI-generated results
High expectations for accuracy and insight

name: Intellectual Property Marketplace
description: Match IP holders with licensees through verified digital transactions.
use_cases: Portfolio monetisation for corporates or investors
risks: Valuation and quality assessment of IP
Low liquidity in many IP niches

name: Ecosystem Data Cooperative
description: Aggregate and monetize anonymized data shared by ecosystem members.
use_cases: Shared data across energy or mobility ecosystems
